alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:25AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.. A strong fall-like low pressure system will move towards Anchorage on Thursday with winds increasing Wednesday night and peaking Thursday morning. The strongest winds will be along Turnagain Arm and the upper hillside where southeast winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 60 mph are likely. Along the lower hillside winds of 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 50 mph are expected. Across the Anchorage Bowl winds will peak around 25 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph possible. People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Rain will accompany the elevated winds, which could make travel difficult.
